info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 4:19PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SCREVEN, HAMPTON, COLLETON AND ALLENDALE COUNTIES... At 416 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a cluster of thunderstorms 7 miles southeast of Burtons Ferry Landing, or 13 miles southwest of Allendale, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph and up to nickel sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Allendale, Sylvania, Hampton, Lake Warren State Park, Varnville, Estill, Fairfax and Brunson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
